page.title: 02The Hamlet of Hassop.
page.content: A handful of houses, a farm, a pub and an unusual church are what now remains of the estate of Hassop. The big house itself, with its gardens and orangery, is now a country hotel. The church, which was built by the Catholic owners of the estate, is an architectural curiosity, being in a heavy Palladian style, of sandstone, with a pillared portico. It now acts as the main Catholic church for the Bakewell District, with many cars coming out each Sunday. The Dower House and farm are next to each other. A very modern barn in which cows are kept throughout the winter is across the road. The hamlet has a public telephone next to the pub.
